Package lazyTrees

Class LazySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>

java.lang.Object
lazyTrees.LazySearchTree<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class LazySearchTree<E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
LazySearchTree is based on FHsearch_tree.java, except it enables lazy deletion. This class is meant to help simulates an inventory, enabling the user to keep track of items added and removed (type of the item depends on design).

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  LazySearchTree.LazySTNode
    An object of this class can be used as a node in LazySearchTree.

    The first/highest node in the tree.
    protected int mSize
    mSize: number of nodes
    protected int mSizeHard
    mSizeHard: tracks the number of hard nodes, both deleted and undeleted.

  • Method Details

    • empty

      public boolean empty()
      Returns true if the mSize is 0, aka list is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the mSize is 0, aka list is empty.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the size of the tree.
      Returns:
      how many nodes are in the tree

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the tree by setting size to 0, and the root to null.

    • showHeight

      public int showHeight()
      Returns the number of 'levels' in the tree, aka its height. Uses helper method findHeight which takes 2 parameters.
      Returns:
      number of 'levels' in the tree.

    • sizeHard

      public int sizeHard()
      Returns the number of both deleted and undeleted nodes.
      Returns:
      number of both deleted and undeleted nodes.

    • findMin

      public E findMin()
      Returns the minimum value node that has not been deleted.
      Returns:
      minimum value node that has not been deleted.

    • findMax

      public E findMax()
      Returns the maximum value node that has not been deleted.
      Returns:
      the maximum value node that has not been deleted.

    • find

      public E find​(E x)
      Find the item in the tree that equates to parameter x, and return it. Makes use of helper method find(mRoot, x) to return the correct data.
      Parameters:
      x - The object we are looking for in the tree.
      Returns:
      the found object, or throw NoSuchElementException.

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(E x)
      returns true if there exists an item in the tree that equates to parameter x. Uses the find function to return the right value.
      Parameters:
      x - The object we are looking for in the tree.
      Returns:
      true if tree contains x

    • insert

      public boolean insert​(E x)
      Attempts to insert parameter x in the tree. If successfull, return true. If unsuccessful, return false. Makes use of helper method that does most of the work.
      Parameters:
      x - The object we want to insert into the tree
      Returns:
      true if successfully inserted. False if not.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(E x)
      Attempts to remove the first node that is equivalent parameter x in the tree. If successful, return true. If unsuccessful, return false. Makes use of helper method that does most of the work.
      Parameters:
      x - The object we want to insert into the tree
      Returns:
      true if deletion is successful. False if not.

    • traverseHard

      public <F extends Traverser<? super E>> void traverseHard​(F func)
      Will traverse all nodes, which means both deleted and undeleted nodes in the tree will be traversed. invokes the helper method traverseHard(func, mRoot) to return correct data.
      Parameters:
      func - The functor to be used while traversing the current instance of this tree

    • traverseSoft

      public <F extends Traverser<? super E>> void traverseSoft​(F func)
      Will traverse all nodes, which means both deleted and undeleted nodes in the tree will be traversed. invokes the helper method traverseSoft(func, mRoot) to return correct data.
      Parameters:
      func - The functor to be used while traversing the current instance of this tree

    • traverseSoft

      protected <F extends Traverser<? super E>> void traverseSoft​(F func, LazySearchTree.LazySTNode node)
      Helper method to soft traverse the tree. Will not traverse deleted nodes.
      Parameters:
      func - The functor to be used while traversing the current instance of this tree
      node - helper prameter so we can recursively traverse the tree

    • traverseHard

      protected <F extends Traverser<? super E>> void traverseHard​(F func, LazySearchTree.LazySTNode node)
      Helper method to hard traverse the tree. Will traverse all nodes, deleted or non deleted.
      Parameters:
      func - The functor to be used while traversing the current instance of this tree
      node - helper prameter so we can recursively traverse the tree

      public java.lang.Object clone() throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
      Returns a copy of this object.

    • findMin

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode findMin​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root)
      Helper method to find minimum value node in the tree. If not found, return null.
      Parameters:
      root - the first node where we start the search. Helps find the value recursively
      Returns:
      Minimum value node found in tree.

    • findMinHard

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode findMinHard​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root)
      return the node in the tree with the minimum value. Ignores the deleted flag.
      Parameters:
      root - is a LazySTNode where search is started
      Returns:
      minimum value node in the tree (deleted or non deleted)

    • findMax

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode findMax​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root)
      Helper method to find maximum value node in the tree. If not found, return null.
      Parameters:
      root - the first node where we start the search. Helps find the value recursively
      Returns:
      Maximum value node found in tree.

    • findMaxHard

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode findMaxHard​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root)
      return the node in the tree with the maximum value. Ignores the deleted flag.
      Parameters:
      root - is a LazySTNode where search is started
      Returns:
      maximum value node in the tree (deleted or non deleted)

    • insert

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode insert​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root, E x)
      Helper method to insert a node into the tree.
      Parameters:
      root - the first node where we start the search. Helps find the value recursively
      x - The item to be inserted into the tree.
      Returns:
      the root of the tree.

    • remove

      protected void remove​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root, E x)
      Helper method to remove a node from the tree.
      Parameters:
      root - the first node where we start the search. Helps find the value recursively
      x - item to be removed from the tree

    • removeHard

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode removeHard​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root, E x)
      disconnect one node at a time marked for deletion from tree
      Parameters:
      root - the first node where we start the search. Helps find the value recursively
      x - item to be removed from the tree
      Returns:
      the node removed from tree.

    • find

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode find​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root, E x)
      Helper method to find a specific node given the root of a tree. If not found, or if the item is deleted, return null.
      Parameters:
      root - the first node where we start the search. Helps find the value recursively
      x - item to be removed from the tree
      Returns:
      the new root of the tree. aka the result

    • cloneSubtree

      protected LazySearchTree.LazySTNode cloneSubtree​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root)
      Clones the subtree and returns it as a new root node.
      Parameters:
      root - contains the subtree that we want to clone.
      Returns:
      Subtree of passed parameter, as a new root node.

    • findHeight

      protected int findHeight​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode node, int height)
      findHeight helper method to count how many levels our tree has.
      Parameters:
      node - contains the subtree that we want to clone.
      height - level of the tree.
      Returns:
      the number of levels in tree.

    • collectGarbage

      public boolean collectGarbage()
      Public method that makes use of the private collectGarbage function which clears the tree of invalid/deleted nodes.
      Returns:
      True if mSize = mSizeHard. False if otherwise.

    • collectGarbage

      private LazySearchTree.LazySTNode collectGarbage​(LazySearchTree.LazySTNode root)
      Traverses left and right to clean up tree calls removeHard() to delete nodes marked for deletion. Is used by the public functoin collectGarbage()
      Parameters:
      root - the root node which is the starting point for our process
      Returns:
      the deleted LazySTNode
